function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Using online methods to collect data during a stay-at-home regulation period.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Distributing the questionnaire through private and group channels in social networking apps.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Restricting participation to indonesian residents living overseas.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and knowledge among indonesian residents about covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate public attitudes and behavioral compliance towards disease prevention","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient sociodemographic data analysis for targeted intervention","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate knowledge and prevention practice related to covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate health protocols and measures taken by the government","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Attention of countries focused on critical intervention for pandemic prevention and mitigation","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid global outbreak of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge and attitude on covid-19 promotion and prevention","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Predicted increase in cases without vaccine availability","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagious disease propagation in urban environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interpersonal transmission risks due to inadequate indoor and outdoor points of interest pois in proportion to resident density and demands.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Travel-related risks for vulnerable communities due to lack of job opportunities near neighborhoods and insufficient support for active transportation.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of affordable housing with resilient building typologies in dense areas, leading to spatial disparities for vulnerable communities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of accessible park areas per capita","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial inequalities for vulnerable populations","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of evidence for the benefits of active transportation modes in relation to generalized biking and walking behaviors","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation between accessible shopping mall area and lower disease case rates in lower-income communities","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct link between spatial allocations of points of interest and infection rate","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long commute time by public transit as a concern for urban attribute","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Total viral load and risk of inhaling infectious aerosols increase with time spent in confined space","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexible mobility choices for long-distance travelers on public transit","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential ramifications of overcrowding in apartment buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data and evidence relating architectural parameters to pandemic resilience","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sustainable urban sprawl leading to inadequate pandemic response infrastructures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High residential building density may facilitate disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High office and retail building density may lead to interzonal disease transmissions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Building-level crowding and room-level crowding can facilitate disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High residential building density and building-level crowding","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate covid-19 testing capacity in the early days of the pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Less predictable human activities due to behavioral changes related to modification of non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High residential building density and longer public transport commute time are associated with higher disease case rates dcr .","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Crowded living conditions, particularly within young and low-income communities, may impair pandemic resilience.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited accommodation of active mobility as alternative commute modes may impact urban resilience to pandemics.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower-income population residing in low-rent areas","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large households with lower urban density and limited transportation alternatives","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Crowded houses accommodating younger, lower-income people with little to no health insurance","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher residential building density relates to a lower dcr in all phases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher building-level crowding relates to a higher dcr in p3-p5.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pt commute time positively correlates with dcr in p3.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential multicollinearity in mlr analysis","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Contagious disease spread due to spatial plots for case studies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of public health impact in mobility simulation for activity data","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of data on individual area of supermarkets and shopping malls","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misrepresentation of human activity due to the use of simple aggregation measures based on zip code boundaries.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low dcr leading to a temporary halt in case increase","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social equity indicators and spatial differences","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Mobility patterns and behaviors during the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
